thread.title: Insurers’ Dilemma: Market Solution Leads to Market Problem
thread.title_full: Insurers’ Dilemma: Market Solution Leads to Market Problem - WSJ

author: Paul J. Davies
title: Insurers’ Dilemma: Market Solution Leads to Market Problem
text:
The role of financial markets is to channel people’s savings into productive activity. In Europe, this process is fragmented and gummed up, leading to Wednesday’s action plan to build a common capital market.
The trouble is a lot of recent regulation already may have hampered the flow of money around the continent. For insurers in particular, incoming capital rules are encouraging companies to put ever more funds in the least risky,... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
